content.label: This game is great! Very similar to advance wars

Theme is solid. Story actually exists to help pull you in. Art is a fun style that doesnt distract. And the gameplay is... well, alternately wonderful and frustrating.

There seem to be no upgrades (which I find frustrating because there are so many ways to try a map with an attempt at 3 stars before its obvious that upgrades are the only way you can succeed, as there is no difficulty rating). Three star ratings seem to be for personal purposes only (so overachievers, prepare to be disappointed). And the unit limits, while nice for purposes of simplicity, can cause issues if you aren't good with a specific unit.

Overall an interesting experience, but I am glad I waited for a sale.
I am not a fan of the level design with the layout of almost each game being you having 5-8 units, no income. Enemy: 10-30 units, decent income. Other than that, fun game

This game is simply amazing, i don't know why some people say it's too hard..but this is strategy game (and not that hard i guess, just don't lose hope)
Minor bugs, game freeze sometimes when you change to another app or lock phone while playing the game but the progress automatically saved :)
I wish ally team in the game is stronger lol
And anyone know how to beat last chapter? I'm stuck :'(

title.label: A great tactics game for iOS

content.label: This game is a nice addition to the iOS library of tactics games, do not be swayed by those who've rated it one star and just complained about the difficulty. If you're familiar with fftwotl or advance wars, you'll feel right at home. This isn't a bad game! If you have an OCD of "I must get three stars before I move on!" Then maybe this isn't for you, however, just know that you can progress through the game and grind it out a bit to return and retrieve said missed stars üëçüèΩ. The game feels fluid and quick plus there's a good assortment of units and legends to unlock and max out. A solid tactics mobile game.

title.label: Fantastic Game (Don't listen to the negative reviews)

content.label: Honestly love strategic RPG games like this. I've been following Mikamobile since Zombieville! Great game and story line, those who say it's too hard obviously just aren't trying hard enough. I'm not even a heavy gamer and I beat 3 story modes with 3 different Living Legends. Fun and addicting game, only thing I would recommend is to come out with more updates of this game and to be able to disable the tutorials!! Hope they come out with a second game!!!

The game is fine. People complaining they can't 3 star level 3, clearly haven't played turn based games before. People complaining it's too hard in general. Yeah don't you want a hard game?? You're paying for it. Why would you want it to be easy....?

This game has the components I'm looking for. I liked the difficulty- Getting to new levels was challenging, and a nice puzzle to figure out, but it never became impossible.  For what it's worth, I appreciate the storyline as well.

title.label: Another failed strategy game on IOS.

content.label:
I think this game is being rated so high because it's Mika Mobile who made it. It's difficulty gets insane, way too quickly. By Chapter 4 (this is your 4th fight!) your put against an army of 9 enemies, with only 4 men of your own. Many of these 9 enemies can, and will, one shot your men. Sure, you can get backup men but by the time you can afford the cheapest and most useless unit, the rest of your men are already dead, or very near dead. This is stupid and completely unbalanced game play that ramps up the difficulty way too soon!

Also, three staring even the second fight is next to impossible because you have to complete it in under 7 rounds. Well, it takes half that many round just to get to the last two enemies, let alone killing the first 3.

This game is just another failed strategy on IOS and a waist of money.
Not on par with their other games. I want my money back.
Too difficult for the casual gamer -- the enemy usually outnumbered the player 4/1. Too simple for the hardcore gamer -- the units are unbalanced without enough variables.

The game had potential but was quickly ruined by the fact that you can't play the game any other way than what the devs want. They added a stars system that force you into 1 line of play and that's it. It's basically angry birds Wild West.SAVE YOUR $3. Tl;dr lazy devs, bad game.

I couldn't wait for this game to be released. So far it's been a great disappointment. The UI and AI are fine. Music, gameplay and animations are ok.  It's just not as much fun as I had expected from a Mika Mobile release. Could they have made it more fun? I'm sure they could have, but they didn't. It just falls flat.

The one other thing that gets me is in app purchases in paid games. I usually don't buy these games, but I did in this case because I had faith in Mika Mobile. Would the boosts made the game more enjoyable for me? Possibly but I'll never know because I refuse to use IAPs for paid games. 

Maybe I was spoiled with the Battle Heart games? Or maybe turn based strategy games such as this aren't for me. 

It's a shame too because they worked so hard for quite a while to release this and judging by the amount of reviews it doesn't appear to be a big hit. I hope I'm wrong.

Did I waste my $2.99? Absolutely not. It's a finished product put out by a quality dev. If you're into this type of game maybe it's for you. It's not for me.

Lacks fog of war, please add that option. Nice western charm/feel to it.
Might try warbits instead.
Would recommend if fog war was added.
3.5 stars out of 5 in current mode 9/30/2016.

First off let me say that I personally LOVE tactical based RPGs like this, final fantasy tactics for the playstation and dungeon of the endless on steam to name a couple where you have to think critically about your parties composition to succeed. Coming from someone who's played these games all his life since he was a kid I can honestly say this is right up there with the best, the only thing holding this game back is perhaps the audience and the fact that theres little to no hand holding, I don't think iOS is a platform for these kinds of games, I'm glad Mika Mobile decided to bring this here, now I and many others have something satisfying to play on this platform in the way of a tactical based RPG. My only real gripe is the lack of online multiplayer but its still a 5 star game regardless.

title.label: Fun Game, but bugs ruin the experience

content.label: I really like the game, but it crashes every time I return after hitting the home button or locking my phone.  That happens constantly when your playing mobile games, so it's a real problem.  Maybe it is iOS 10 related. If they fix that issue, this would be a 5 star game.

Every time Mina mobile releases a new game I get very excited they have all been 5 star games for me. This game is absolutely awesome. The music, sound effects, the story (still haven't beat it). The only thing that lets me down is the battle animations. When you compare this game to other strategy RPGs it excels in all area except for that. Take, in my opinion, the greatest strategy RPG ever, fire emblem. You move your units across the map, the same way you do this, but when you come into conflict you go into a better graphics fight. I know it's something petty, but it's one of the small things I've always enjoyed about other. Also the in app purchases for a paid for game. Other than those two things the game is still with the 2.99$, just not 5 stars.

Fun little game. Creative unit variety. AI needs some major work, they will build non combat units (buffing units like Snake Oil Men) when they have no units left which makes zero sense. But overall it's still pretty challenging.

If they added some minor RPG elements, instead of your hero/units progressing on a 100% linear path, would probably be a 5/5 game.
Great game. Lots of units to choose from and levels to play. Very polished game overall.
This game is insanely difficult.

It's very hard to make everyone happy.  And that's just because everyone has different tastes.  I personally LOVE this game.  I was a HUGE fan of Advance Wars and this is the closest thing I have found to it.  I hope some more maps are coming.  I would happily pay extra for more content.

This game offers a really entertaining combo of fun and challenge. The levels are entertaining even on repeated plays, thanks to the star-earning system. Every character you put on the board counts and every round is important. Difficult to put down!
One of the best strategy games i have ever played. It's fun, smart with excellent storyline.

I'll try to write a review of the game as it is, and not how I wish it were.

The game itself if a turn based strategy game with light RPG elements that affect your units' power. Maps are hard and there are some moments that depend on luck. There's some element also of getting used to how the AI makes its decisions which can make the game feel more luck driven than it may be.

Another thing they've done well is the IAP system, which effectively let's you pay very minimal prices to get access to quasi-expansions. I applaud this choice as it will hopefully help Mika stay afloat and allows players to pay for as much extra content (up to a point) as they'll enjoy. It's elegantly and non-intrusively implemented.

The game I was hoping this would be was a tactical turn based replayable RPG (with randomized maps) in which I could play the Legend characters as a single party together on each map. Perhaps they'll make an expansion like that. A turn-based western-themed battle heart, I suppose (FFT-like). I recognize if that's what I want I should look elsewhere as that's clearly not the game Mika wanted to make, and it would be hopelessly foolish for me to review them on the basis of what they didn't want to make.

Overall fun game, would recommend for folks who like unit-driven tactical strategy games.

I'll add this: your mileage will vary for replay value. If you like pass-n-play multiplayer you'll enjoy this one, if you don't you'll be playing the same missions over and over with slightly varied unit characteristics.

Lastly, minor bug: the necromancer's perk that makes graveyards heal also heals enemy units -_-

These guys made one of my two favorite app games battleheart legacy (other is faster than light). So buying this was a no brainer. I like srpg's from back when I was a kid. Plays out like a shining force type game with more disposable characters.

10 levels in and I've decided to delete this game. Why, you ask? On the surface it looks great - good value for money, retro turn based strategy with a fun western theme and characters. So what happened?? The gameplay is simply flawed. Every level is painful to play. From about lv 5 on the game is so tough, and odds so stacked against you it just becomes a miserable, unforgiving unsatisfying experience. There is no flexibility in gameplay or strategy. Let me explain - it's like playing a game of chess repeatedly except the opponent has 4 times the number of chess pieces and has setup the board so massively in his favor that there is only one possible way to win. Not only that but the opponent can infinitely respawn new units every turn (from all of the bases it gave itself at the start of the game of course!). To compound things further, you can only get 3*s on a level if you finish with very few units defeated (I can live with that) and - and this is what makes me fuming - within an impossibly short timeframe. It's a miracle to win a level at all, but when you see that 1* you worked so hard for it just makes you feel sad. It's a shame because the game has real potential if they just fixed the reward: pain ratio and gave greater flexibility to the player in terms of strategies to win. I absolutely love these kind of strategy games and thrive off the challenge. Unfortunately this game offers me zero motivation to carry on given the pain and heavily stacked odds in the AI's favor. Stay clear of this game unless you're a masochist.

This is game is great for anyone who may have enjoyed the advance wars series. It offers some missions that are completed with general ease and some missions that took me quite some time to complete. It is extremely difficult to be OCD and get all the stars but it is complete able nonetheless. Overall this game is wonderful and has had me hooked for several days playing this over some more in depth games I have and enjoy. Would love to see a map editor which would add even more replay ability but overall a great game that gave me a bit of nostalgia with some wonderful new and exciting environment.

I have played through the campaign two times and I am on my third play through now.  Such a cool feature to be able to play through with different main characters.  I really enjoy this game, and highly recommend to fans of strategy or turn based style games.

LOVING this game! It is very much like the Fire Emblem games with a western cowboy theme. The controls are fantastic and music/audio has a catchy western feel.

I've put in about 10 hours so far and only about 4 missions out of 24 or however many. You can pass each mission with 1-3 stars; if you just go for 1 star it's pretty easy. But going for all 3 is quite challenging, even on the early missions. 

If you like Fire Emblem (or FF Tactics) you will most definitely get your money's worth.

Like most of the other reviews are saying...this game has some major problems with difficulty settings. It's completely random. An easy fix to this would be to add the ability to adjust difficulty on an individual level basis. 

Due to this issue, I find myself not playing this game nearly as much as I'd like to. If this problem was fixed I would be all over it all the time. 

Other than this issue, the game is awesome. I was a huge fan of advance wars and this a great reimagining of that game. Same mechanics with better graphics and animation and a new setting/story.

I've always wanted a western strategy game since like forever. Mikamobile has totally hit the mark with a sensationally fun and challenging western strategy game with a little twist. The game has several units at the player's disposal that range from "cowboy tanks" to werewolves! The combat and story are great, along with an awesome random match lobby. I did find the matches a little chaotic though with multiple players all going and moving several units. I did also encounter a few bugs along the way with camerawork and a couple weird story missions. There is like no real explanation to what strategy in the game looks like, but I loved that aspect! Awesome game, I'd love more like it! Totally worth the $!!!
Buy it, love it, support the team and auto level up a few characters. No regrets here. Hope they make more of this gold

title.label: Above average game. Hard is good.

content.label: I think the game really deserves barely 4 stars. I gave 5 because I feel an incredible sense of rage when I see people giving 1 star reviews because the game is hard. Honestly that is unbelievable. Get better at the game. No wonder real gamers don't take mobile seriously.

Plz plz change: 

Ranges seem random. Unclear why troops are able to move certain amounts of spaces in one direction but not the other.  Also, it is difficult to determine enemy troop ranges because game does not show potential maneuverability, just where they can move at the moment. This is problematic when I am trying to get my troops out of enemy range but when I move my troops, the range changes because my troops were blocking the other troops' movement ranges. For example, my medic and gunslinger are in range of a cavalry, so I move them both back one space each. But now they are still in enemy range because my medic and gunslinger were just blocking its full range and giving it a smaller range, but now since they moved back a space the cavalry is able to use its full range and still attack them. Plz plz just make it easier to see the enemy troops' actual ranges.

Super super annoying thing:

While playing as Wyatt Wilcox I unlocked the skill to give my riflemen the ability to shoot one space away, but this ability does not apply to my "living legend" himself. Therefore, my regular riflemen are almost superior to Wyatt Wilcox because they can shoot point-blank and he can not. This doesn't make sense because Wyatt is supposed to be the best rifleman but the regular expendable riflemen are better. 

There should be a skill tree for the living legends as well. 

Some levels are challenging in a fun way. However, some levels are just plain hard and boring because the enemy has such a huge advantage. In fact, some levels take up to an hour to complete(50 rounds).

title.label: Fun game with lots of potential...

content.label:
First and foremost, this is a great strategy game with lots of depth. It's unique, addictive and entertaining on all counts. The characters are well designed and the layers of strategy are thick. I definitely recommend it.

That being said, I do have a handful of gripes. The difficulty is a bit ridiculous at the beginning, but with a little patience, you'll slowly develop your strategy and get the hang of it. Even while improving your tactics, I wouldn't necessarily consider it well-balanced.

There are a few missed opportunities... I agree with reviews that criticize the lack of user-control while leveling up. It would at least be nice to have a summary of the Legends' stats so you can compare strengths/weaknesses between the characters. When I see 5% increase of some stat, that increase is relative to only that character... I have no frame of reference to how it compares to other characters.

Also ‚Äî a minor detail and miscellaneous observation ‚Äî the level select seems like it needs to be visualized over a map of some kind as opposed to a table. That would be more conceptually relevant to the story.

The most significant issue with the game is that a character can reach maximum level before their story is complete. The problem with this is that while playing the later levels, your character doesn't gain any more experience while attempting to beat a level. So if you're defeated before completing that level, you don't receive any experience and therefore you have nothing to show for it. In my experience, this diminishes motivation for completing the game with that particular character.

Despite those fairly minor issues in the big picture, this is a great game and I'm looking forward to future updates!

title.label: Good, could have been more interesting

content.label:
Good thing first: good strategy game. Theme and story line is good. Lots of levels, currently 24. Have three modes to play: main story, challenges, custom games. Interesting part is legends which are main characters with special characteristics.
Not good part: it's get very hard in story mode after level 15. You can literally feel that it's one sided which kills interest. I am stuck at level 16 from last 4 days. 
Another boring part is that you cannot skip opponents move. U have to wait until opponent completes his move, you have fast forward option but still it takes time and Kills fun.
There are similar turned based strategic games but this one has potential to be unique with several changes.

I love playing this game.  But the difficulty is all over the place.  I beat the first 3 levels without losing, although with only 1 star most of the time.  But after that, I have had to play some levels 8-9 times before I am able to beat it.  I almost never have problems with games, but playing the same level over and over again to get to the next level to play over and over again is very frustrating.  The losses are usually bad at the beginning.  I have 6 units and no money and get 200 dollars per turn.  The computer has 15 units, 2 taverns for making more units and gets 400 per turn.  So they usually destroy me.  But who can win with those odds?!?!  Then when I finally do beat it, it's a significant victory.  It seems like there is no happy medium.

I went from not even wanting this because, even knowing the quality games that MM puts out, I thought this was just a sort of cheap knock-off of Advance Wars, to absolutely loving this game and winding up with it currently on my 2016 GOTY list. Is it like Advance Wars? Sure... absolutely, you can make that connection. But having 9 different legends/heroes to play through the game with, each with their own strengths/weaknesses, and each with their own 'save' (you'll have to start from Stage 1 if you're playing with a Legend you've never played with before, regardless of how far you've gone/what level you are with another character), has added just enough to really shine as it's own entity. And to clear things up - you do not have to pay to get the extra heroes. You start with 3 and unlock the other 6 as you progress through the game. The IAPs are ONLY THERE IF YOU WANT TO INSTANTLY MAKE YOUR LEGEND A LEVEL 40 CHARACTER (MAX LEVEL). That's it. The difficulty is a bit on the high side... but if you're a strategy fan, chances are it'll be just difficult enough to provide a decent challenge, and if you do ever get stuck, you can go back and replay previous levels to earn more EX and level up your character a bit before trying it again. But there really is no hand-holding here. It's a strategy game, and wears that title as a badge of honor. 
The only real negative thing I can say about the game is that units are unlocked/brought out a little slow. It would have been nice to have everything by stage 5-6-7, somewhere in there... but this is just a personal preferance. All units are unlocked in the other two modes; Challenge Maps (pre-made skirmish-like maps with goals like the Story Mode [defeat all enemies/less than x casulties/finish before turn x/ect...]) and Custom Game (single-device pass-n-play with 2-4 players). So I really can't complain. I do hope to see some online MP, which is strange, because I'm not really a fan of MP... but for whatever reason, I'd love to see it implemented here. Even without that.... this is a must own for strategy fans, though, if you're not a strategy fan, I'd go and read some reviews/watch some gameplay videos before diving in, even if you loved Mika Mobile's previous offerings. This might not be the best game to ease you into the genre... =oP

THANK YOU MIKA!!! =oD

Pros:1. runs smoothly like battleheart
2. Graphic remains developer's style, which is good.

Cons:
1. As a 2016 game, did not bring any new ideas into this kind of strategy games. 10 levels into this game and you feel many other old games already had everything this game offers, even better. 
2. Design many units, however the game just gives them to you without any cost, challenge or sense of rewarding. And there is no telling if new units actually help you in situations.
3. Level design doesn't make you feel you "earned" something.you just...beat the game...and nothing. No sense of achievement or complement. 

Overall,I'm  very disappointed this is a 2016 game. If this is the best they can do after battleheart. I'm sure something is not right in this company.

So far I love it. I have managed to get three stars on the first 5 levels that I have played. Levels 4 and 5 probably took 15-20 tries each to get that elusive 3rd star. The great thing is that I learn a little bit each time. Knowing how to use each unit to maximum effect, and more importantly which unit to buy is key. It is difficult but fair. The value for your money is insane. I will easily have several hundred plays before finishing with my first character, and there are three to play plus the challenge maps.
Level 15 is IMPOSSIBLE ghouls coming from both sides and your tiny army is surrounded.
Great game. Very fun but you should add multiplayer matches, like with the same set up as the custom games
This was one of my favorites, till level 21. Level 21 the difficulty just goes off the charts. This game could use a difficulty slider cause even with my hero at max lvl it's beyond difficult.

title.label: Best advance wars like game on App Store

content.label: Enough said
Can't even get past chapter 6 there is no possible way it seems be tried every possible thing not worth the money

After the first level the game takes a noticeable difficulty spike which is fine but as the game progresses the difficulty gets just dumb to the point where it would be impossible to get 3 stars. Once u get to the levels where u face undead hordes their is no yo little strategy its just the enemies all out rushing u and your defenses getting slaughtered. This is especially so for the spell casting undead that get extreme range and damage and can attack and move on the same turn. To make matters worse they turn the defenses they kill against. This game could be solid but with ridiculous difficulty its just extremely dumb and boring. As the game is now its not worth the 3 bucks

I enjoyed the first five levels immensely, even though some were surprisingly challenging and required more than a few replays. I would really appreciate the game if there was a level of customizability for the legend so that the player could choose what the legend looks like and what skills they want to pursue.

title.label: A good Advanced Wars style game

content.label: This game is similar to Advanced Wars but has enough differences to keep it fresh. Some people are complaining about the difficulty but I find it to be similar to Advanced Wars.
Great take on the AW formula. I would love to be able to level my heroes in custom games vs AI however. Just sayin...

title.label: Difficulty spike ruins an otherwise great game

content.label: I'm all for a game being challenging, but this gets too tough too quickly. There's such a tiny margin for error, even by level 3, that going for 3 stars quickly gets frustrating. This is compounded by the lack of a quick restart option. Hopefully the next update will sort these niggles.
